unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Average Price of Homes: T Procedures
question_text: A realtor is interested in the average price of homes in his state. He randomly selects 16 homes 16 homes and records the prices. Under what conditions could T T procedures be safely used in this situation?

choices.text: As long as the sample is larger, say over 30 30 , T T procedures could be used in this case.
T T procedures can be used only if the problem states that the parent population is approximately normal.
T T procedures cannot be used in this situation as it would be more appropriate to use Z Z procedures.
T T procedures can be used in this situation as is.
T T procedures can be used in this situation as long as a graph of the data shows no strong skewness or outliers.
